attend.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class
attend.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Please let us know if you are unable to attend.
attend.translation[0].definitions[0].not: In everyday English, people usually say go (to) or come (to) instead of attend:
I didn’t go to the parents’ meeting.
Please let us know if you can’t come.
attend.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to go regularly to a school, church etc
attend.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: I am the first child in my family to attend college.
attend.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to happen or exist at the same time as something
attend.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: the peculiar atmosphere which attends such an event
attend.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to look after someone, especially because they are ill
attend.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: On his deathbed the General was attended by several doctors.
attend.translation[0].definitions[3].not: Attend is often passive in this meaning
attend.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to go to an event such as a meeting
attend.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The two men both attended a 90-minute board meeting yesterday.
